description: DC-OSPF generates this trap when the state of a virtual
interface changes.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfVirtIfStateChange DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmEntRouterId a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapVirtIfAreaId a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapVirtIfNeighbor a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmVirtIfState i 1 DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapPmEntIndex u 9999

description: The configured Router ID.
This is a 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in the
Autonomous System. For example, it is usually set to the
smallest IP address belonging to the router.
If this field is set to the default value of zero (0.0.0.0) then
DC-OSPF will choose a Router ID. Otherwise, DC-OSPF will use
this MIB configured value.
ospfPmEntCurrentRouterId displays the Router ID currently in use
by DC-OSPF.
When the Router ID is chosen by DC-OSPF, it is equal to the
highest loopback address on the router, or the highest active
interface if there are no loopback addresses.
This field cannot be changed if the row is admin status up and
row status active.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmEntRouterId

description: Version of ospfPmVirtIfAreaId used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapVirtIfAreaId

description: OSPF virtual interface state.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmVirtIfState

description: Version of ospfPmEntIndex used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapPmEntIndex

changes.

event.Summary: State of a neighbor changed to $v5

variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapAddressLessIf

description: The IP address of an inbound packet that cannot
be identified by a neighbor instance. When
the last value of a trap using this object is
needed, but no traps of that type have been sent
this value pertaining to this object should
be returned as 0.0.0.0.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPacketSrc

description: Potential types of configuration conflicts.
Used by the ospfConfigError and
ospfConfigVirtError traps. When the last value
of a trap using this object is needed, but no
traps of that type have been sent, this value
pertaining to this object should be returned as
noError.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfConfigErrorType

description: OSPF packet types. When the last value of a trap
using this object is needed, but no traps of
that type have been sent, this value pertaining
to this object should be returned as nullPacket.

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfNssaTranslatorStatusChange DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmEntRouterId a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapAreaId a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmAreaNssaTranslatorState i 1 DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapPmEntIndex u 9999

description: The configured Router ID.

variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmEntRouterId

description: Version of ospfPmAreaId used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapAreaId

description: Indicates if and how an NSSA Border router is
performing NSSA translation of type-7 LSAs into type-5
LSAs. When this object set to enabled, the NSSA Border
router's OspfPmAreaNssaTranslatorRole has been set to
always. When this object is set to elected, a candidate
NSSA Border router is Translating type-7 LSAs into type-5.
When this object is set to disabled, a candidate NSSA
Border router is NOT translating type-7 LSAs into type-5.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmAreaNssaTranslatorState

description: Version of ospfPmEntIndex used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapPmEntIndex

description: DC-OSPF PM generates this trap when it enters or leaves
graceful restart helper state for a neighbor on a network
interface.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'Device enters or leaves graceful restart hitless helper state' : 'Device enters or leaves graceful restart w/o hitless helper state of reason $v7'

description: Indicates whether the router is acting as a hitless

variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmNbrRestartHelperStatus

description: Remaining time in current OSPF hitless restart interval
if the router is acting as a restart helper for the
neighbor. Set to zero if OSPF is not currently acting as
a restart helper for the neighbor.

description: Describes the outcome of the last attempt at acting as a
hitless restart helper for the neighbor.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmNbrRestartHelperExitReason

description: Version of ospfPmEntIndex used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapPmEntIndex

description: DC-OSPF PM generates this trap when it enters or leaves
graceful restart helper state for a virtual neighbor.

Summary.eval: ($v6==1) ? 'Device enters or leaves graceful restart hitless helper state' : 'Device enters or leaves graceful restart w/o hitless helper state of reason $v7'

DC-OSPF will choose a Router ID. Otherwise, DC-OSPF will use
this MIB configured value.
ospfPmEntCurrentRouterId displays the Router ID currently in use
by DC-OSPF.
When the Router ID is chosen by DC-OSPF, it is equal to the
highest loopback address on the router, or the highest active
interface if there are no loopback addresses.
This field cannot be changed if the row is admin status up and
row status active.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmEntRouterId

description: The current operational state of the OSPF Protocol Manager entity.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmEntOperStatus

description: Version of ospfPmEntIndex used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapPmEntIndex

description: DC-OSPF PM generates this trap when its graceful restart
status changes.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfRestartStatusChange DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmEntRouterId a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmEntRestartStatus i 1 DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmEntRestartExitReason i 1 DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapPmEntIndex u 9999

description: The configured Router ID.
This is a 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in the
Autonomous System. For example, it is usually set to the
smallest IP address belonging to the router.
If this field is set to the default value of zero (0.0.0.0) then
DC-OSPF will choose a Router ID. Otherwise, DC-OSPF will use
this MIB configured value.
ospfPmEntCurrentRouterId displays the Router ID currently in use
by DC-OSPF.
When the Router ID is chosen by DC-OSPF, it is equal to the
highest loopback address on the router, or the highest active
interface if there are no loopback addresses.
This field cannot be changed if the row is admin status up and
row status active.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmEntRouterId

description: Current status of OSPF hitless restart.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmEntRestartStatus

description: Describes the outcome of the last attempt at a hitless
restart. If the value is 'none', no restart has yet been
attempted. If the value is 'inProgress', a restart
attempt is currently underway.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfPmEntRestartExitReason

description: Version of ospfPmEntIndex used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-MIB::ospfTrapPmEntIndex
